mechanoreception.notes: As soil centipedes, Geophilidae likely rely heavily on mechanoreception to navigate and detect prey in their environment. Given their fossorial lifestyle, tactile senses are probably well-developed.

chemoreception.notes: Chemoreception is likely important for locating prey and mates in the soil environment.

vision.notes: The presence and functionality of eyes in Geophilidae is unclear from the given context. Many soil-dwelling organisms have reduced or absent vision.
